snippet: A letter described as written by an employee of Xinhua, the main state-run news agency, spread quickly on the Internet. Then it was taken down.
abstract: Letter signed by Zhou Fang, man who allegedly works for China's state-run Xinhua News Agency, accuses country's censors of using Mao-era smear tactics against critics; letter has been widely circulated online, and  reflects growing discontent over Pres Xi Jinping's insistence that state-run media closely obey Communist Party.
lead_paragraph: A letter described as written by an employee of Xinhua, the main state-run news agency, spread quickly on the Internet. Then it was taken down.

headline.main: China’s Censors Denounced in Online Attack
headline.print_headline: Letter Assailing Censors Spreads Online in China as Discontent Over Controls Rises
